title: Caramel Rolls Recipe
description: Easy caramel rolls filled with butter and cinnamon and topped with a sweet, gooey pecan sauce will make your holiday breakfast memorable and special.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Bread Yeast Bread Recipes Caramel Rolls 4.5 (6) 6 Reviews 3 Photos Caramel rolls are my absolute favorite thing on earth. They're perfect for all holiday mornings! Submitted by HungerGames12 Updated on March 19, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 45 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 1 hr 50 mins Total Time: 3 hrs Servings: 9 Yield: 9 rolls Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 9 servings Dough: ¾ cup water 2 tablespoons butter 2 cups white bread flour 2 tablespoons white sugar 1 ½ tablespoons nonfat dry milk powder 1 teaspoon fast-rising dry yeast ½ teaspoon salt Sauce: ½ cup brown sugar ¼ cup light corn syrup ¼ cup butter ¼ cup chopped pecans (Optional) Filling: ¼ cup butter, softened ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon Directions Make dough: Combine water, butter, bread flour, white sugar, milk powder, yeast, and salt, in that order, in the bucket of a bread machine. Select the Dough cycle. Remove dough from the machine after the cycle is done, about 1 hour 45 minutes. Meanwhile, make sauce: Combine brown sugar, corn syrup, and butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes. Pour sauce into an 8-inch square baking pan. Sprinkle with pecans and set aside. Fill dough: Turn dough out onto a floured surface, punch it down, and roll into an 8x12-inch rectangle. Dot with butter and sprinkle with cinnamon. Roll up and pinch seams together. Slice roll into 9 equal pieces, about 1 1/3-inches thick; place cut-side down into the baking pan on top of pecans. Set aside until rolls are doubled in size, about 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in the pan for no more than 3 minutes; invert a serving platter on top of the pan, then turn over. Carefully remove the pan to release rolls and allow pecan sauce to flow over rolls. Add Your Photo Photos of Caramel Rolls 01 of 03 Photo by  Kim 02 of 03 Photo by  Kim 03/09/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser There are simply no words to describe how good these rolls are--all I can offer you is the sound of inhuman grunts and groans in between bites as I devour one after the other. They are INSANELY delicious. The rolls are soft, not overly sweet, and the caramel? OMG TDF. My alterations to the recipe were to make it the old fashioned way, since I don't have a bread machine. I proofed my yeast in the warm warm; mixed all my dry ingredients a large bowl; added the butter (which I melted first) then the yeast mixture. Kneaded dough by hand for 8-10 mins, adding more flour as needed. Placed dough into a well-oiled bowl and let it rise for 90 minutes; then proceeded to follow the recipe instructions from there. I did also add a bit of brown sugar to the filling alongside the cinnamon and butter. As for the caramel, I added some salt, vanilla, and a couple tbsps of heavy cream before pouring it into the pan with the pecans. The rolls rose beautifully, and were perfectly baked at 25 minutes. They came out of the pan like a dream, too. These rolls are some of the best things I've ever made--so thank you for sharing your recipe! It's beyond amazing! 03 of 03 Photo by  HungerGames12 12/04/2012 1 You’ll Also Love Best Ever Caramel Rolls 14 Ratings Betty's Famous Cinnamon Rolls 77 Ratings Cinnamon Crown Rolls 5 Ratings Cinnamon Rolls II 747 Ratings Overnight Burnt-Butter Cinnamon Rolls 2 Ratings Caramel Pull Aparts 3 Ratings Caramel Cinnamon Rolls 5 Ratings Bubbling Bread Sticky Buns 10 Ratings Strawberry Cinnamon Rolls 4 Ratings Caramel Pecan Sticky Buns 5 Ratings Grandmother Stougaard's Caramel Pecan Sweet Rolls 83 Ratings Chef John's Chocolate Croissants 22 Ratings Kouign-Amann 110 Ratings Best Ever Cinnamon Pull Aparts 84 Ratings Sourdough Cinnamon Rolls 5 Ratings Overnight Caramel Pecan Rolls 260 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: HungerGames12
instructions: Make dough: Combine water, butter, bread flour, white sugar, milk powder, yeast, and salt, in that order, in the bucket of a bread machine. Select the Dough cycle. Remove dough from the machine after the cycle is done, about 1 hour 45 minutes.;Meanwhile, make sauce: Combine brown sugar, corn syrup, and butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes. Pour sauce into an 8-inch square baking pan. Sprinkle with pecans and set aside.;Fill dough: Turn dough out onto a floured surface, punch it down, and roll into an 8x12-inch rectangle. Dot with butter and sprinkle with cinnamon. Roll up and pinch seams together. Slice roll into 9 equal pieces, about 1 1/3-inches thick; place cut-side down into the baking pan on top of pecans. Set aside until rolls are doubled in size, about 1 hour.;Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool in the pan for no more than 3 minutes; invert a serving platter on top of the pan, then turn over. Carefully remove the pan to release rolls and allow pecan sauce to flow over rolls. Kim
